title: SOLENOPSISM
body_text: A state of paradoxical loneliness experienced by an individual who is part of a collective consciousness or hivemind. The feeling of being isolated despite being interconnected with others who share the same thoughts and experiences.
subtitle: /ˈsoʊ.lən.ɑp.sɪz.əm/
quote: A portmanteau of solipsism and Solenopsis, the genus of fire ants.

title: Solipsistic Tendencies
body_text:
We exist in a sea of shared experience, surrounded by those who feel what we feel, think what we think.

Yet somehow, this very sameness amplifies our isolation. Our loneliness is born from the impossibility of truly being seen within the collective.

title: People are a Hivemind
body_text:
Solenopsis—fire ants—move as one superorganism, each individual subsumed into the colony's collective will.

But, even within this perfect unity, does any single ant experience its own existence? The hivemind promises belonging but end up giving anonymity.

title: OUR DIGITAL HIVE
body_text:
Modern society has perfected the conditions for what I call solenopsism.

We scroll through feeds of people living our exact struggles, join communities built around shared identity, yet feel more alone than ever.

The algorithm connects us to thousands who understand, but also reveals that understanding alone cannot cure isolation.
We are fire ants in a digital colony, moving in perfect synchrony while searching desperately for something that feels uniquely ours.
